Explanation

In this page, we explain the uncertainty estimation and the visualizations we have used in this evaluation tool.

Our simulation generates many possible variations of the same fiber tract (i.e., originated from the same seed-point). You can think about it, as performing the scan and tractography multiple times consecutively for the same person and capturing the variations in the results. These variations in the fiber tract arise due to underlying uncertainty sources like acquisition noise. We can make the simile to evaluate the precision of a specific laboratory test,we perform it multiple times in the same conditions and we then analyze statistically (i.e., mean, median, error intervals â€¦ ) the results.

One sample: A single test is performed to get one result, e.g., 0.3. Similarly on fiber is obtained from a single scan.


Multiple Samples: Multiple tests are performed obtaining multiple samples in same conditions. Similarly, multiple fiber samples are obtained from our simulation. We can use statistics to summarize for example compute the median or compute the representative fiber (in red)

Statistic intervals distribution is often important to understand probable variability and remove outliers. Here, 75% variance (i.e., 75% chance a sample falls in the interval) is shown.
